title: Email
content: I moved my email from Eclipse webmail to Thunderbird. I cannot import all my old email messages into Thunderbird. Thunderbird is only showing email messages from the day I signed up. My Eclipse Webmail is still accessible and the old emails are still there (it's IMAP). I went onto Chat GPT and was given various options to get the emails to sync but no luck. Now run put of options. Any suggestions?

title: Sending multiple emails from Outbox
content:
I have recently installed version 146.0.1 on a new computer, was using 115.10 before. I regularly put about 50 emails in my outbox using the mail merge add on and then send them in one go. I have done this very successfully for a long time using my Fastmail email account. Now after sending about 10 of the emails, Thunderbird hangs and I have to restart it to send the next 10. If I send them via my Gmail account it still works fine. I am trying to understand if this is a Fastmail or Thunderbird issue. I would have liked to try it on my new computer but with version 115.10 but cannot do this as it seems that the Profile is different.

Any advice gratefully received.

Thanks Bob
creator: bob.sillitoe

title: email updates
content: My last email received was Dec.28 ,11:PM ,today Dec.29,8:30 AM with nothing to update my e-mails as of this writing .I usually have many emails every morning ??????????
creator: bluesky2

title: Text color won't change in Thunderbird 146.0.1 (32-bit) for Windows
content:
For some time the feature to use color in text has not worked. I deleted and re-installed Thunderbird but no change. I cannot change the font color when typing an email, and making changes in the settings has no effect, either.

I have my "signature" saved as an HTML in color, and it also will only display in black.

Any articles and solutions posted seem to be for people using Macs or some other kind of computer. I have Windows 11 for a Lenovo Idea Pad 5. Thank you in advance for any and all guidance you can offer.
creator: esicluna00

title: Thunderbird not storing IMAP message bodies on local computer
content:
Thunderbird is not saving IMAP message bodies to my home computer.

My settings: - Keep messages in all folders on this computer is checked. Under "Advanced" all the folders are checked for download. - Synchronize all messages locally regardless of age is on.

If a message has some significant graphics there is a fairly long delay before the body is shown. I know that this is a characteristic of IMAP. But if I close Thuderbird and return to it later, the same message will again have the download delay. Clearly it is not being stored on my computer.

Any help will be appreciated.

Thank you, Paul
creator: paul142857
